name: HD 66428
scenarioDescription:
The HD 66428 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 66428 is a star with 1.08 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.1 times its radius. It is located 174.04 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.515 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 66428 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 66428 system


HD 66428 b

HD 66428 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.47 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 66428 b is 1018.8720000000001 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 66428 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 66428, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
